docblock.description: This class represents a complete HTML document.
docblock.long-description:
It offers convenience functions for getting and setting elements of the document such as setTitle(), getTitle(), setMeta($name, $value), getBody().

Internally it uses HtmlPageCrawler to navigate and manipulate the DOM tree.

docblock.description: Set a meta tag

tag.name: TODO
tag.description: : add support for multiple meta tags with the same name but different languages

docblock.description: Sets innerHTML content of an element specified by elementId

tag.name: param
tag.description: If provided, output will be saved to this file, otherwise returned

docblock.description: remove newlines from string and minimize whitespace (multiple whitespace characters replaced by one space) useful for cleaning up text retrieved by HtmlPageCrawler::text() (nodeValue of a DOMNode)

tag.description: If no param is provided, returns the HTML content of the first element

Filters the list of nodes with an XPath expression.

tag.description: A new instance of Crawler with the filtered list of nodes

docblock.description: Adds HTML/XML content.
docblock.long-description:
Function overriden from Crawler because there is a hardcoded default charset latin1, we need UTF-8, and no way to override the charset for html fragments which do not contain a content-type meta tag

So the only difference to the parent function is: if given an HTML fragment without content-type meta tag, we process it as UTF-8, not latin1

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string to parse as HTML/XML

tag.name: param
tag.description: The content type of the string

docblock.description: Adds an HTML content to the list of nodes.
docblock.long-description: Overrrides the original function form Crawler for loading of HTML fragments. Crawler::addHtmlContent always loads HTML code as complete document, i.e. a HTML fragment will be wrapped in tags. This function keeps HTML fragments as they are.

docblock.description: Get a XML representation from a HTML code fragment for use with DOMDocumentFragment

tag.name: param
tag.description: Fragment of html code (MUST NOT contain html and body tags!)

tag.name: return
tag.description: XML code fragment for use with DOMDocumentFragment::loadXML
